title: How to Lower and Raise Cordless Blinds

steps.title: Gently push and pull the bottom rail of the blinds up and down.
steps.content: Gently push and pull the bottom rail of the blinds up and down. All you have to do to open and close cordless blinds is lift up (to raise) and pull down (to lower)! Simply place your hand on the bottom rail. Then, either pull down or push up gently. The blinds will follow suit. [1] X Research source If your blinds are installed hanging from the top of your window, the rail should be at the base of your slats or shade. If your blinds are installed at the bottom of your window, the rail should be at the top of your slats or shade. If you are having trouble lowering your blinds with the rail, contact the company that installed them or your local window treatment store to get an inspection. If your cordless blinds are motorized, simply use their remote or an app to control them. This will be specified when the blinds are installed.

steps.title: When the blinds won’t lower
steps.content: When the blinds won’t lower If your blinds won’t close, you likely need to activate the spring mechanism. Pull on the bottom rail of the blinds gently to as far as it will go. Tug quickly 3 or 5 times to reactivate the spring to release tension and lower the blinds. [2] X Research source

steps.title: When the blinds won’t go up
steps.content: When the blinds won’t go up If your cordless blinds won’t open, chances are it’s because the spring mechanism inside is locked in place. Remove the blinds, then look along the top or bottom of the blinds for a pin. Turn the pin clockwise to increase the tension. Remount the blinds once they’re adjusted. [3] X Research source The pin is usually located where the tension mechanism is on the top or bottom of the blinds, in the headrail or bottom rail. [4] X Research source You may need pliers to reach and turn the pin.

steps.title: When the blinds are uneven
steps.content: When the blinds are uneven If your blinds are starting to look topsy-turvy, pull them all the way down. Then, grab the inner cords in the left and right section of the blind. Tug and pull them out as far as you can. Let go quickly so the cords snap back. [5] X Research source

steps.title: When the blinds are stuck
steps.content: When the blinds are stuck If your cordless blinds are stuck in one position, it’s likely because the tension mechanism is jammed. Remove the blinds and check for kinks in the strings or broken pieces. [6] X Research source If the string is bunched up and cannot be moved, or something is broken within the mechanism, it’s time to replace the blinds.

steps.title: Why do your blinds not have strings?
steps.content: Why do your blinds not have strings? Your blinds likely don’t have strings because they’re cordless. This means that the blinds move up and down by pulling or pushing on the bottom of the blind, not yanking a cord.

steps.title: How do cordless blinds work?
steps.content: How do cordless blinds work? Cordless blinds raise and lower without needing to pull a visible string. This style of blind has a tension mechanism insider the headrail or bottom rail. When pushed or pulled, strings move along the mechanism to increase or decrease tension, allowing the blinds to stay up or down. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Why aren’t your cordless blinds working?
steps.content: Why aren’t your cordless blinds working? There are a few reasons why your cordless blinds may not be going up or down. Here are some of the most common: [8] X Research source The spring mechanism inside the blind needs to be re-engaged. The spring mechanism is worn out and needs to be replaced. The blind cords are tangled.

steps.title: How do you close blinds manually?
steps.content: How do you close blinds manually? If your blinds do have a string, test it to see how they work. Pull one side of the cord—do the blinds move up or down? Experiment by pulling on either side of the string cord until your blinds are in the desired position.

steps.title: How do you move panel track shades?
steps.content: How do you move panel track shades? Use the guiding wand to move the shades left or right. Panel track blinds are another type of shade that doesn’t involve cords; however, these move side to side. Either use a guiding wand (or your hand) to pull the blinds forward or back.
